name: Abba Parque Hotel

reviews.text: Everything feels new and modern, very comfy room. Parking in cellar,
reviews.title: Fine hotel - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is near a park as its name suggests. No park views though. Our mission was to accommodate two adults and three kids for about hundred euros. The hotel is modern, clean and tidy. The room was great! Perfectly divided in two parts with a door so kids could sleep peacefully while mom and dad watched late nite TV.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was somewhat serious, but did their job well enough. Maybe they´re more ofthen reciving business men than families with kids.
reviews.title: Parking ripoff and poor soundproofing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While driving along the North coast of Spain, Bilbao is a nice stop between Donostia (San Sebastian) and Santander. The city is pleasantly burgeois, with a river, trams, the Guggenheim Museum and good pinchos (basque tapas) in every corner.
reviews.title: Awful receptionist, tired room, but breakfast great.

reviews.text: This hotel has a big issue with sound proofing. The 1st night I was woken at 1 AM by a couple with a a toddler, they banged around for 45 mins with the child speaking at the top of it's voice. I could hear it clear as day. They checked out but the next day I had a couple with booming voices who wanted the TV on loud. No way could I sleep so I changed rooms, the staff were helpful but seemed to know that the soundproofing wasn't good . Even after I changed rooms it was obvious that even with the TV on at average volumes you could hear it inthe distance the same applied to voices. Would I come heer again probably not because of the noise issue I;d try somewhere else..
reviews.title: Soundproofing is an issue here

reviews.text: This is all a pity because the hotel has a great location for the Guggenheim and lots of tapas places (just come out of the hotel and turn left). The rates are good value. The rooms are spacious, a little worn at the edges but nothing serious. The bathrooms are clean and boast a good selection of toilettries. They have free WIFI (ask at the desk) and the breakfast isn't bad for 11 euros with hot food, bacon eggs etc. The staff are kind and helpful. Thy have a solarium and turkish bath and fitness centre for use by guests. Pity about the noise really
reviews.title: Good choice for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice business type hotel with reasonable prices (we paid 61 euros per night not including breakfast). The hotel is in a convenient location (on Rodriquez Arias just east of Avenida de Sabino Arana), a fairly short walk from the Guggenheim and the Museo de Bellas Artes, and the Licienciado Poza tapas area, as well as a few blocks from the tram line that runs to the old city. However, the desk staff was not very helpful. It is useful that it has a parking garage, though it is 22 euros per night and it is very difficult to get into and out of because of small spaces and tight turning radiuses. The hotel also has a view of the Guggenheim from a small rooftop seating area (though you can only see the view when standing up).
reviews.title: Great value hotel near centre

reviews.text: Great value hotel - executive rooms are spacious with nice bathrooms.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate for 3***

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Near centre of town on tramline to the old town & guggenheim. Some nice bars and restaurants nearby but the find in Bilbao is Tarot Asialink a new Indian/Pakisani restaurant on Hernani just over the river from the old town - excellent curry - probably the best I've had outside England! and it makes a great change from the very samey spanish restaurant menus.
reviews.title: A great bargain!

reviews.text: The Hotel is in a great location - in a quiet side street about five minutes from the river and ten or so minutes from the Guggenheim.
reviews.title: Good location - adequate hotel
Excellent hotel, incredible price
reviews.text: The entrance area gives a false impression - it is very modern and shiny. Service is indifferent!
However, once into the room that opinion changes - the room was clean but in need of renovation. That said, I was in Bilbao to see the city so as a place to sleep it was more than adequate.
reviews.title: A fine place to stay in Bilbao
Great Place to stay
reviews.text: I came to this hotel after staying in its sister hotel in San Sebastian (NH Aranzazu), and I am happy to report the same high standard, except that this hotel was even cheaper! I could not believe that I got a hotel of this quality for about 65 euros for the night. I got a very large, comfortable room. I am not sure what the official star rating was, but I would put this at 5 star quality. There was an excellent buffet breakfast for a fairly reasonable price. When I travel, the most important quality I look for in a hotel is CLEANLINESS. This, and its sister hotel, were absolutely excellent in this regard. The location was excellent in central Bilbao. I would definitely stay here again.

description: Located in the commercial heart of Bilbao, Hotel Abba Parque is 100 metres from San Mamés Bus and Metro Stations. It features a gym, free Wi-Fi, Turkish bath and a restaurant. All air-conditioned rooms at the Abba Parque Hotel include a minibar and satellite TV. They also come with a private bathroom and a hairdryer The Abba’s Botavara restaurant serves a varied breakfast buffet, as well as daily set menus at lunchtime. The hotel also has spacious lounge areas and a 24-hour reception with tour desk. Situated next to Iturriza Casilda Park, the Abba Parque is just 600 metres from Bilbao Fine Arts Museum and Euskalduna Conference Centre. The Guggenheim Museum can be reached within a 15-minute walk.
